page.title: 04Employment in the Wolfords
page.content: In the Wolfords there are 72 people in full-time employment and twenty (mostly women) working part time. 2 are unemployed through injury, two are mentally handicapped and two are unemployed and seeking work. 14 are in farming, 7 in the retail trades and 5 in the building trade. 3 work in the motor industry and two in other industries. There are two at the fire college, Moreton in the Marsh, two teachers, a soliciter and an architect. In addition, Little Wolford boasts 3 hairdressers, a gardener, a long distance lorry driver and a clerk to the course (horse racing). The vicar, publican and postmistress all live and work in Great Wolford. There is also a haulier hospital worker and civil servant. Seven professional/ managerial men in a variety of fields complete the list.
